turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Bombing of Mannheim in World War II.
turn.2: Bombing of Mannheim in World War II The German city of Mannheim in the state of Baden-Württemberg saw bombing during World War II from December 1940 until the end of the war.
turn.3: How many times was it bombed?
turn.5: Why were they able to find it?
turn.6: Mannheim was the subject of Allied air activity from the earliest days of the war.
turn.7: Was there any controversy about it?
turn.8: Although these early flights had reconnaissance as their aim rather than air raids.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: As The Times of 13 November 1939 notes, quoting a British official communique -  During the Battle of France, the Royal Air Force raided Mannheim as part of a night of raid attacking Nazi Germany's oil infrastructure.
turn.12: In The British government had developed plans for the large-scale area bombing of cities from the summer of 1940, but waited for an opportunity to present itself.
